results.title: Rubbery figures: the world's greatest treasurer
results.creator_credit: Rubbery Figures Productions, Peter Nicholson, Cynthia Mann and Leigh Tilson
results.brief_description: A compilation of rubbery figures skits that first featured regularly in the Australian television comic series of the late 1980’s “Fast forward”. An irreverent and satirical play on the then Australian Prime Minister and treasurer (and comic duo it seems), Bob Hawke and Paul Keating. Includes skits Evil Kneating, Back to the Future and more. Puppeteers: Esther Haskell, Jenny Ishmakovich, Jenny Sherlock and Kath Gordon.

results.title: Rubber plantation
results.brief_description: An overview of rubber manufacture in Malaysia. Shows the tapping of trees and the method of collection of the latex, as well as the processing of the latex in the factory. Also covers aspects of the system which caters for the rubber workers such as education and health. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: Rubber in today's world
results.brief_description: Reviews the history of rubber from its discovery to its use today as a basic commodity, including primitive methods of manufacture, improvements through vulcanisation, and modern production and process from plantation to market. Shows sources of and major steps in the production of synthetic rubber.
results.description: Reviews the history of rubber from its discovery to its use today as a basic commodity, including primitive methods of manufacture, improvements through vulcanisation, and modern production and process from plantation to market. results.title: Rubber in roads
results.creator_credit: Maxwell Munden, Film Workshop and Dennis Shand
results.brief_description: Improvement of road surfaces by the discovery that mixing a small quantity of natural rubber powder with bitumen makes a harder wearing surface. Tests carried out in the laboratories of the British Rubber Producers Research Associations.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Maxwell Munden, Film Workshop and Dennis Shand

results.title: Rubber in building
results.brief_description: Illustrates the many ways in which rubber can be employed in building processes: tyres, conveyor belts and hoses used in contractors equipment; extractable rubber core used in the pre-stressing of concrete beams; sound proofing system of floating floor construction using rubber under floor battens etc.

results.title: RSVP = Retired Senior Volunteer Programme
results.creator_credit: Barry Pierce, Tasmanian Film Corporation and Bob Connolly
results.brief_description: The Retired Senior Volunteer Program offers retired people volunteer work with organisations who can use their expertise. This Government funded program is unique in Australia. It gives senior citizens meaningful work in retirement.

results.title: Royal Wedding
results.creator_credit: Arthur Freed, Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer and Stanley Donen
results.brief_description: Fred Astaire delivers a magnificent series of dancing performances in this outstanding musical which also stars Jane Powell, Sarah Churchill, Peter Lawford and Keenan Wynn. Fred Astaire plays the role of a journalist sent to cover the Royal Wedding in London. This is the film which used the revolutionary photographic techniques which allowed Fred Astaire to do his famous “dancing on the ceiling”. Rated: G

results.title: Royal tournament
results.brief_description: The Royal Tournament presented annually by the Armed Forces of Britain at Earls Court, London. Massed bands, gymnastic displays, horse-riding and military manoeuvres are included in the display.

results.title: Royal Stirling
results.creator_credit: Campbell Harper, Films of Scotland and Mark Littlewood
results.brief_description: The town of Stirling is at the centre of Scotland’s history, as those battles which determined her independence were fought within sight of Stirling Castle. Historical landmarks contrast with the newly founded University which has brought a sense of new life to the area.
